page.title: 09Religion in Willingham
page.content: There are four churches in Willingham; St.Mary's{(Church of England),}the Tabernacle{(Baptist), Salvation Army and{Methodist.}St.Mary's is the Parish Church, in charge of the Rector. From about the year 1000 Willingham was closely associated with the Abbots of Ely and, after 1109 with the {Bishops of Ely.}For 600 years the Church was the chief land-lord around Willingham, most of the villagers paying rent to or working for the Bishop. About 35 families are regular worshippers at St.Mary's. There is a {Sunday School,}attended by about 20 children, where they sing, write and draw on biblical themes. The age range is from 3 to 12. The Salvation Army also has 4 classes for children aged from 2 to 14. They wear uniform: tie, hat and navy skirt/trousers.
